author: Special Correspondent
text:
The valedictory of the centenary year celebrations of the St. Thomas Orthodox Cathedral on Stringer Street, Broadway, was marked by a special service at the cathedral led by the head of the Orthodox Church, Baselios Marthoma Paulose II and later, a public meeting held at the Ewart School auditorium on Sunday.

The public meeting was attended by other bishops of the Church including its Bishop of Madras Diocese Yuhanon Mar Diascoros and Chennai Mayor Saidai S. Duraisami, a press release said.

The British-built church, originally the Garrison church for British soldiers in Black Town, was handed over to the Orthodox Church in October 1916. It was the core of the first congregation of the Orthodox Syrian Christian community outside of Kerala. There is a significant number of Orthodox Syrian Christians who have made Chennai their home.
title: Centenary of cathedral celebrated
